I had high hopes for this movie. Parasite is an all-time favorite of mine, so I figured Bong Joon Ho’s proceeding film would be just as amazing. So let’s talk about the good: Robert Pattinson is such a versatile actor, easily the star and standout. The way he’s able to change his voice is unparalleled from playing Batman to the Heron in “The Boy & the Heron.” In this movie, he plays twins, who truly do feel like two different characters… more

Confesso que no início fiquei meio travado com Mickey 17. Mas à medida que o filme avança, algo começa a me chamar atenção, um incômodo que cutuca e pergunta: o que é o homem, senão uma peça que o sistema troca quando convém? Bong Joon-ho, mais uma vez, orquestra uma crítica feroz ao capitalismo, assim como em "Parasita". Dessa vez, vestida de uma comédia ácida e ficção científica. Aqui, o trabalhador é literalmente clone: descartável, e ainda assim obediente. Tudo… more

Assisti Mickey 17 e fiquei com aquela sensação estranha de não saber se gostei ou não. O visual é lindo, a proposta é interessante e tem momentos que realmente chamam a atenção. A ideia da clonagem, da identidade, do sacrifício... tudo isso me prendeu. Mas, ao mesmo tempo, senti que faltou algo. A história tem umas falhas, uns momentos meio arrastados. Não achei o filme ruim, mas também não sei se é realmente bom. Fiquei dividida. Talvez eu precise assistir de novo pra decidir se é genial ou só bonito demais com pouca entrega.
Can’t ask for anything else out of a movie seriously! Slightly too good to be true ending but it had to wrap up somehow. Overall great experience!

Chock full of symbolism, a stacked cast, and beautiful cinematography it had all the makings for a great film. Perhaps that’s what put me off slightly. It was disjointed, scenes like puzzle pieces that didn't quite fit but were jammed together anyways, character motivations I couldn’t quite decipher, and an overall dreamlike quality to the film. That of course could have all been intentional, and if so, I commend the director for his commitment to details. I’m not sure what… more

This movie had a really intriguing concept, but the execution fell flat. The story could’ve been much tighter if they had simply focused on taking us through each of the 18 Mickeys in sequence starting with the first and ending with the last while exploring how his personality shifts with each iteration. They briefly touch on the idea that every Mickey has a different personality, but they don’t go deep enough, which feels like a missed opportunity. The subplot involving… more

Too much to think, too little to write? I never freaking know how Bong Joon Ho's movies are gonna go. Every time I think "ah, now I get it, THAT'S where it's headed!" I get thrown a curveball and it swings directions. I'm legitimately impressed with the creativity of it all. I'm taking off half a star because the story very quickly turned to caricature (on purpose, I'm aware) and I think I would've enjoyed a little bit more character substance overall, but honestly it's more a question of preference than anything. Also, Mark Ruffalo and Robert Pattinson are excellent actors. I'm impressed.

And of course Robert Pattinson who surprised me on this role nailing the personality of 2 different characters quite well. That’s my two cents worth

« Oh mon dieu, le remplaçable c’est multiplié ! Ils sont très dangereux. Il faut aller les arrêter avant qu’il ne soit trop tard » Toute la clique, armé jusqu’au dent, se déplace pour tuer tous les multipliés. Il entre dans leurs cachette. « Arrêtez vous, bande d’enf… » Ils s’aperçoivent que Louis 14, Louis 15, Louis 16 et Louis 17 forniquent depuis un bon bout de temps. voilà c’est un film qui claque, fait tout lui apprendre à ce coréen.

Mickey Barnes, após problemas com agiota, é obrigado a fugir da Terra. Para isso, aproveita um programa de colonização espacial, onde ele irá atuar como um "descartável", mas sequer lê o contrato com detalhes de sua função. Agora ele se torna uma espécie de cobaia de testes mortais, sendo sempre clonado após morrer.
